reviews.text: Really interesting habitat that's not found many places anymore. The gardens are a work in progress, and the map doesn't always accurately reflect the trails, but we thoroughly enjoyed the wildlife. Can rent binoculars in the new visitor center (which is an old plantation house). Nice lookout over the Rio Grande.

I went for a walk around the area, it was nice and calm. The admission was $5 and to rent a pair of binoculars was $2 (and turning in your ID until returning binoculars). It was a good experience and enjoyed the serenity of the environment. I however wasn't able to see much wildlife but that didn't stop me from having a good time.
The gardens can use some work. It was nice to hike around the trails. We went when it was too windy so didn't see many butterflies. Going to try again on a calmer day

This is a hidden gem, a wonderful old plantation house with  pathways cut through palm trees down to the Rio Grande. There are some bird feeders for bird watching and informational signs about the vegetation. Bring lots of bug spray and enjoy strolling the grounds.

Active Owls nest, rain forest feel when you walk the TRAILS. Staff is so knowledgable and friendly. Bird feeders let you get up close and personal with so many different birds.  Take the family (pack a lunch, kinda isolated)!!!!

Adding my 5 star review. What a fabulous zoo. YOU CAN FEED GIRAFEES HERE!!! The monkeys were all very active, the staff were all very engaging with my curious kids. We also loved the splash pad and the playground. It's very smartly placed halfway through the zoo. A very enjoyable day.

A really neat zoo with many open-air exhibits and fun trails to walk! It was a little rainy the day we went, so some of the animals weren't out, but we were surprised by how many we still saw. We loved all the flowering vines and trees that gave the zoo a "jungle" feel! Would definitely come back here again!

Unfortunately, the Dinosaur exhibit was kind of lacking. The dinosaurs moved, which was interesting and the facts were informative but since the space was limited, the exhibit was small. The small water parks help with the heat, they are refreshing. Yet to see the butterfly exhibit but overall, my kids love coming to the zoo!

Looking to have a kid friendly "wild time"??  This is your place to come in Brownsville during the week, while school is in-session, making for a very enjoyable day. Consider the VIP Tour that gets you a behind the scenes access with a catered lunch to wrap up your guided visit of this non-profit organization's mission to preserving endangered animals.
Nice zoo. Small zoo , you really have to take your time admiring the animals or you’ll be done with zoo too fast. They have a nice/fun kids area. Were they can get wet.
Out of this world.  Starry eyed.  Wow.  Surreal.  So cool.  No other words.  💥⚡🌠😎💞☘

As SpaceX test the starhopper, photo ops are becoming more of a challenge. The times they choose to close route 4 are variable. That being said, it is still way cool to be able to get so close to rocketship.

I was on my way to the Beach on Boca chica and space x was doing testing so they closed the road to the beach for 45 min. Durning spring break
 I had forgotten about them being there

We went to Spacex for second time to see how far the project is up to today. My little boy was super excited! Unfortunately the security guard was extremely rude yelling (YELLING YELLING) at us that “You have to leave NOW,“. I felt intimidated. He could say it firmly and explain that we can take pics from the other side of the street. So rude . March 13th 2019 at 12:45 pm
Just a cool place to visit with Boca Chica beach right there next to it to have a full day of enjoyment!

We attended a fashion show here. The main room was totally transformed for the show. The space was perfect, and the staff friendly. I’m from out of town and this made a perfect night to my trip. I hope to get to come back during normal business hours. But I give them 5 starts for hosting an event.
Great cultural experience with amazing local Art and Artist as well as Instructors and staff!! Worth the membership fee!
Great national and local installations. Also has facilities available for rental! Nice place to spend a few hours near our awesome Zoo!

It's a small town museum and reflects that spirit. It is primarily 4 galleries and on the day we visited hosted a main exhibition by a national artist held in 2 galleries and in the ancillary wings, there was a group exhibition of local talents and a solo by a regional artist. Honestly wasn't expecting the Menil but assumed that the lights would of been turned on to view the paintings. Overall a cute and raw fine arts haven.
Amazing place full of culture!
Always a spectacle to see so many things to admire here from the past of American Aviation

Difficult to find and when we did find it, it was closed.  Sign on the door said the lost tear least and will reopen in March.  It would be very helpful if someone would update their website.  It is clearly out of the way at the Brownsville Airport.  Not very well marked.
Beautiful vintage aircraft! It’s a shame that they will be leaving somewhere else in January 2018. Recommend this to the history lovers!
When we got here it was really hard to find due to it not being in drive view ,we got here and said it was closed for two months. Wish thay had mentioned that on there site

The volunteer there have me, my wife and our 6 year old grandson what amounted to a private tour. Somewhat disappointed in the types of aircraft on display but the volunteer made up for that. He even let grandson sit in his personal plane
Small music focused --- a new larger building is being constructed
I have led many presentations here. Unique place to hold events.
Small museum and when we asked the folks there to recommend a "local" restaurant they said nothing was near.  Yet a block away was a bakery and 2 blocks away there are LOTS of non chain restaurants.
Good place to know the city history.

It's a great place to come and receive a little knowledge and history of the city of Brownsville. The train display was also nice.  They only charge 6 dollars per guest but if you are military or retired military..i there is no entry fee. Bring the kids and learn together. Great place for some quality family time

Loved it but watch out for snakes. We nearly stepped on a 5' Diamond Back near the battlefield overlook but that just increased the fun of our visit (we're Aussies & used to snakes). Before taking the walk go into the HQ & ask to see the video. Makes all what you'll see there much clearer. Nice display of artefacts & history in the HQ.
Small park, but very well done. Good and up to date exhibits. Very helpful personnel. Make sure to spend time in visitor center and see film while there, and at least walk out to overlook.
Very beautiful and quiet historical place! Nice to enjoy the views of nature that come along with this historical area! Fun for the family or just to enjoy with friends! Highly recommended!
What an amazing experience. The information on site and provided by Rolando was great! Highly recommend this as a visit for locals and travelers alike.
We had a really enjoyable visit. Perfect weather. Learned so much regarding its history. And the park personnel were courteous and helpful!
Pretty place. Please do not drive on the dunes, or even onto the beach...it's very disturbing! Park & walk those legs!
It is way out of the way.  You have to want to be here to come here.  Nice and peaceful.  No development, but looks like Space-X is setting up a launch site right next door
Love the beach.   Not crowded,  and things of shells.

Remote! 
Best kept secret in Texas. 
Deserted beach with no hotels but a few old houses near the north end.  

There used to be a store about 5 miles back toward Brownsville but it was closed the last time we went past. If you need anything be prepared to drive back to Brownsville. 
We have seen a few fishermen but usually there's nobody there. It's quite a ways to the Rio Grande which is the border to  Mexico. It seems like a step back into history when you come here, like maybe you would see an old-time pirate ship anchored off shore!
Nice place. Long drive. Great views.
Always a spectacle to see so many things to admire here from the past of American Aviation

Difficult to find and when we did find it, it was closed.  Sign on the door said the lost tear least and will reopen in March.  It would be very helpful if someone would update their website.  It is clearly out of the way at the Brownsville Airport.  Not very well marked.
Beautiful vintage aircraft! It’s a shame that they will be leaving somewhere else in January 2018. Recommend this to the history lovers!
When we got here it was really hard to find due to it not being in drive view ,we got here and said it was closed for two months. Wish thay had mentioned that on there site

The volunteer there have me, my wife and our 6 year old grandson what amounted to a private tour. Somewhat disappointed in the types of aircraft on display but the volunteer made up for that. He even let grandson sit in his personal plane

Adding my 5 star review. What a fabulous zoo. YOU CAN FEED GIRAFEES HERE!!! The monkeys were all very active, the staff were all very engaging with my curious kids. We also loved the splash pad and the playground. It's very smartly placed halfway through the zoo. A very enjoyable day.

A really neat zoo with many open-air exhibits and fun trails to walk! It was a little rainy the day we went, so some of the animals weren't out, but we were surprised by how many we still saw. We loved all the flowering vines and trees that gave the zoo a "jungle" feel! Would definitely come back here again!

Unfortunately, the Dinosaur exhibit was kind of lacking. The dinosaurs moved, which was interesting and the facts were informative but since the space was limited, the exhibit was small. The small water parks help with the heat, they are refreshing. Yet to see the butterfly exhibit but overall, my kids love coming to the zoo!

Looking to have a kid friendly "wild time"??  This is your place to come in Brownsville during the week, while school is in-session, making for a very enjoyable day. Consider the VIP Tour that gets you a behind the scenes access with a catered lunch to wrap up your guided visit of this non-profit organization's mission to preserving endangered animals.
Nice zoo. Small zoo , you really have to take your time admiring the animals or you’ll be done with zoo too fast. They have a nice/fun kids area. Were they can get wet.
chinese food and the setting at this spot is excellent. Service is always timely even when they have a full house. The place has a great feel to it. Feels like a place in Los Angeles I loved.
Great food no matter what time your there, friendly staff all on top of things
A favorite location for chinese food. looking forward to coming back with my coworkers. the bill was good for how much you get.
Loved it... Food & service was awesome
Good food, good prices... What more needs to be said
seafood, super delicious. super place to meet and chat with coworkers. quick and friendly service. bring your appetite because portions are generous.
Food was excellent. Fish, scallops, shrimp were fresh.  I just hoped their shrimp cocktail would have the option to add avocado, other than that it was great.
My preferred location for tasty seafood. Got there about two, it was not packed. This place has a great design. Reminds me of a cafe in Chicago I liked to visit.
The freshest seafood and the best fried shrimp!! The staff is very friendly and attentive. A restaurant that should last generations.
Traditional Brownsville seafood joint that looks like it's been there for decades. Great prices, well-prepared food but playing and presentation could use a modern tweak. I'll be back.

I've eaten here about 3 times and this last time around, I was not a fan of the attitude of the waitress we got or the owner. The waitress didn't really care to give us a good experience, the other two waitresses, however, were polite and very sweet. I will say that we did get our food fairly quickly after ordering so that was a positive note on this visit.
Anyway, fast forward to the paying part and the owner didn't even acknowledge my husband and I even though we were standing ready to pay. I gave her my card, she slid it on the machine and she told us "I guess the machine isn't going to take the card haha." Real professional.

All in all, even though the food was decent/good, I won't be returning to this location.
Love it here! Great food and prices.

We go to this place pretty often and I can't say we've had many bad experiences. The tostadas de pechuga are pretty good although I feel like the second tostada is a little much, but I'm not complaining. The tacos enmolados are also really delicious. Honestly I haven't really had anything bad on the menu. I feel weird giving it anything less than 5 stars. Not because this place is outstanding, but because you can go here and expect to have a good experience. Maybe sometimes I wish the waiters would come to us more but the place is small enough to where the waiter is always in sight if you need something. In all honestly this is a unique Mexican restaurant and you probably won't find the types of dishes this place has anywhere else.

AGAIN, I gave this place 5 stars because you can go here and expect a good experience and a good meal.
Good food good customer service
Mostly all around good

The food is EXCELLENT. Huge servings, good prices. We enjoyed every last crumb.

The customer service is SLOW. We were in there for nearly an hour before the food arrived, and it wasn't busy at all in there. Just make sure you have plenty of time on your hands.

The ladies' night deal sounded excellent, so take advantage of it!
Great customer service can't complain. They have the best Mexican food! I loved the place
Delicious food at a great price,  free coffee with order
Flautas are gross. Dont eat here
Loved the food and great service!

Recently went today as a walk-in for lunch. Had the turkey avocado sandwich. Very happy with my choice :) The bread is delicious!!!  You have to wait a bit, but it's worth it. Everything tastes so fresh. Yumm.....
Food was fantastic!! Loved the carrot soup and caprese salad.  The soup was one of the best I have ever had.  If you want fresh and delicious food go here, you will not be disappointed.
This place is so cool, the DJ bought shots for my group of friends because we were the ones keeping the place hella lit!

Not impressed. I guess I was expecting more of a restaurant feel, so maybe I'm not judging it fairly. The drink specials looked like they were decently priced. Water tasted dirty. We ended up leaving before ordering.

I looked at the menu and it didn't explain anything.   Brick oven pizza doesn't tell you the topping.  Wings 6 dollars but doesn't say what sauces.   Sample platter but doesn't say what the samples are.   How can I order.   I ask bartender and she says it's bar food.  Just cause it's barr food doesn't mean I don't want to know what I'm ordering.
I give this place two thumbs up. Prices that won't break you. Menu is similar to a restaurant in Jacksonville I loved.
Had a good time, our server was very nice. Crysta was our server, very nice and beautiful young lady
Italian food... very delicious. Visited Sat afternoon. There was fast, efficient, and courteous service. This place has a nice design.
Excellent location for tasty italian food. The staff was friendly and sociable. This place has a good atmosphere.
Loved the atmosphere and the wide variety of authentic Italian food.  Pizza was out of this world!  Cappichinni was excellent.  Highly recommend to try this place.  ~♡~
Very cozy place and delicious food with a dish that can feed 2! Love it!
Little tricky to find but a good place to eat
Love this place! Best wraps in the valley. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Brownsville.
My mother and I love this place. It's healthy, they have great wraps, and the best smoothies I have ever had. We're going back tonight. Pretty good service. Only complaint was our table was uneven.

Overall, good food, and a variety of things to choose from, including healthful fruit smoothies. The atmosphere was a little loud and boisterous for my tastes, but the staff were friendly.

It did bother me a little that some of the staff commented, "...but the [ingredients] are only a day old..." That is a little scary, especially when fresh vegetables are a) not fresh after a few hours, and b) day-old vegetables are...well, shall we say, a little wilted.

Further, the staff, unfortunately, seems to think that mediocre service is acceptable. What they don't realize, is that patrons don't come to be tolerated; they want to be made to feel special.

Could stand to make the space a little more sedate and quieter, and keep those vegetables fresh...please!

Has a lot of potential to be a great healthful alternative to your standard 'meat and potatoes' type fare. A little more thought and due diligence would be in order.

Love the food it's delicious and they are super accommodating to making it just how you want. However, the drive thru line needs to pick up the pace. I ordered a sandwich and it's taken ten or more minutes! I actually have time to write a review on a restaurant (and this never happens). Love this restaurant just wish drive thru service was faster. People in cars have to go places!

Slow service, overpriced for what you get, and the lettuce was wilted. I am happy to pay $9 for a gourmet and fresh baguette sandwich, but it was neither.  The bread, advertised as a baguette, was not.  Instead it was hoagie bread.  Very little meat and after eating half the sandwich, I noticed that the lettuce was wilting quite a bit (see photo).  The only thing that made the sandwich gourmet was the pesto sauce.  The lentil soup was okay, but nothing special.  After waiting in the drive-thru for a long time and being the only customer, this was a great disappoinent.  I will not be back.   To the owner, please speed up your service and learn what a gourmet baguette sandwich is and make sure your employees toss the wilted lettuce.  Also the name, Kaero, makes you think it's going to be Japanese food.  You should pick a new business name or better advertise what you're selling.  Your competition is Jason's Deli and so far they easily win.
Great food at a great price. Their bread is delicious and I don't even like to eat bread. The soft Italian music in the background goes well with lunch or dinner.
Italian food and service here is very good. Got there near seven, it wasn't very crowded. The staff was helpful and kind. Prices were reasonable. They have a lot of good reviews for a reason.
Great spot for tasty Italian food. the bill was decent for the quality. feels similar to a restaurant in new york i loved.
Really enjoyed the meal. Service was great. David, our waiter, was very pleasant and accommodating.

Regardless of where you go eat, you'll only return if the price is right for the quality of service. Let's just say if time were a factor, then this place is a hard pass. Quality isn't anything better than your mother's kitchen. Food is stale and cold, plus the salad is apparently a 30 min entree. Don't get me started with their cold lasagna, which is supposed to be cooked in an oven. Okay, now how was the service? Better question, did they even have servers? I was neither approached immediately or even asked to sit down. For a "fancy" place, this was more ghetto than Southmost, and that's saying a lot. Drinks apparently come with one serving and after you have to ask a dozen times for another. Your order is meaningless, you'll be lucky to even get it at all 45 mins in. Best forget this location for lunch or any time. If your passion isn't in it for the food, at least be in it for the service, if not just close your doors.

Honest pretty disappoint with the boneless wings. I’ve never had wings with such a weird texture. Cheese fries were ehhh - They’re kinda thin and soft and they give you a bucket load. You’re best off eating them with a fork.
Good food, good service a bit slow for not been so busy. But quality was good warm and tasty. Clean establishment. I will recommend no problem. Oh also good specials.

Great thiqq wings and service; I went around noon for the daily special and it was a breeze. Wasn't slow nor busy. Had boneless buffalo lemon pepper and my lady had a bacon wrapped hotdog. Both were amazing 🤙
My family and I really enjoy going to this wingbarn. The boneless are huge. I love that.

Tried their lunch special, 8 boneless wings. Great presentation, good quality chicken (for boneless), they even served 9 instead of 8! Thin breading had a texture similar to Carl's Jr./Hardee's/Wendy's, or some frozen nugget brand. The flavor was good too, although more subtle than pronounced. Fries were on the mushy side. 

This place has potential though it's not something I'll repeat, write home about, or recommend. Sorry y'all!
Great experience. Very good service. Extremely nice hostess (Jenny)  and our server was very professional.
I wish I found this place sooner. Very good. Good date night spot.
Just had lunch at Fisos. I had the salmon and it was fresh and tasty!  Service was top of the line!  Atmosphere was very relaxing.

Excellent - great food, the atmosphere is very high quality & the service is that of a high-end expensive restaurant. Prices were lowered about 8 mos ago, so it’s very well priced for such an awesome restaurant.
The food is really ugly and I saw a cockroach on one of the main dishes. The waitres was giving really bad service and the cost was really high.🤢🤢🤢🤢
One of my preferred locations for delicious Quality Meals. You won't be disappointed in the menu and service. The service here is attentive. They have a lot of positive reviews for a reason.
Great location for quality Quality Meals. service is always timely even when they have a full house. the staff was helpful and kind. this place has an awesome atmosphere.
quality meals at this location - very good. staff is always timely even when they have a full house. the service was very friendly and kind. this place has a nice atmosphere.
Service was excellent..Very nice and relaxing ambiance. Food needed a little more temperature. My pork meat was almost room temp. Good selection of wines and martinis...

My wife and I celebrated our 48th anniversary here tonight and it was truly an unforgettable experience!  Christian, our server, was there any time we needed him without being in the way.

We started our meal with a brie and prosciutto appetizer and  we each had a salad with brie and bacon, along with greens.

She had tenderloin medallions and I had the beef tenderloin.  We finished all this off with creme brulee.  I'm still full!

All the food was above our expectations!  We are already planning our next anniversary there.

Add-on for a year later.  Went back there for Valentines Day, had the same server, Christian,  and nothing had changed.  The food is superb, the service was top drawer and we love it!

Our dinner experience with Ricardo was wonderful...great waiter. He was friendly attentive to details. He explained the menu to us and was happy to ask the chef to make additional additions to our requests. Food was excellent also....our compliments to the chef.

Have only been here once. My husband and I loved the food (their Toscafino chicken is awesome!) and their cucumber martinis are pretty good, too. I don't know if looks the same during the day, because we went for dinner, but it was a little too dark for us here.
The lunch plate was extremely tasty. Enjoyed my experience. Staff was very attentive although not fast paced. Highly recommend
One of my favorite spots for delicious Italian food. i wish there were more places like this around town. the service was very welcoming and sociable. feels similar to a cafe in chicago i liked.
First time and Ricardo recommended some dishes. We tried his recommendations and they were both delish. Can't wait to go back...
